Package metro.algorithm.map

Class StationsLock

java.lang.Object
metro.algorithm.map.StationsLock
public class StationsLock
extends java.lang.Object
Class used to ensure that trains only move when the station's entrance they're headed to is not occupied.

The assumption is that a train reaches a station when one of its wagons is on a tile adjacent to the station. There can be many trains at one station as long as there's max one on each tile adjacent to this station.

It creates and uses a list of Conditions from a given lock, one for each station's entrance

  • Constructor Details

    • StationsLock

      public StationsLock​(metro.algorithm.map.TunnelsMap mapWrapper, java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock lock)
      Parameters:
      mapWrapper - reference to the TunnelsMap instance
      lock - a lock used in the synchronization process

  • Method Details

    • lockDestination

      public void lockDestination​(Coordinates destination, java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition supervisor) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      Locks the lock and waits until the destination entrance is not occupied. Marks the destination as occupied.
      Parameters:
      destination - coordinates of the destination to occupy
      supervisor - a condition that is signaled if the destination is locked. Used to launch the next train in case this one can't move.
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - a thread may wait for the entrance to be released

    • signalStartingPoint

      public void signalStartingPoint​(Coordinates startingPoint)
      Marks the starting point as not occupied and signals the trains waiting for it to be released. The lock should be released manually
      Parameters:
      startingPoint - coordinates of the entrance to be released

    • isThreadIsWaiting

      public boolean isThreadIsWaiting()
      Checks if there is a thread that's waiting for an entrance that was released.
      Returns:
      true when a thread is ready to travel, false otherwise
